intro: Hieracium pseudeuroum, commonly known as the false hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough texture. Hieracium pseudeuroum is often found in meadows and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
